title: Establishes the police officer and firefighter loan forgiveness program
summary: Establishes the police officer and firefighter loan forgiveness program for eligible police officers and firefighters who attend certain colleges and reside in a city with a population between 250,000 and one million.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         2173

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PEOPLES-STOKES -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education  law,  in  relation  to  establishing  the
         police officer and firefighter loan forgiveness program

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new section  677-b
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  677-B.  POLICE OFFICER AND FIREFIGHTER LOAN FORGIVENESS PROGRAM. 1.
    4  CERTIFICATION. POLICE OFFICER AND FIREFIGHTER  LOAN  FORGIVENESS  AWARDS
    5  SHALL  BE  AWARDED EACH YEAR. SUCH AWARDS SHALL BE ALLOCATED AS PROVIDED
    6  IN THIS SECTION TO ELIGIBLE POLICE OFFICERS AND ELIGIBLE FIREFIGHTERS AS
    7  CERTIFIED TO THE COMMISSIONER BY THE PRESIDENT.
    8    2. ELIGIBILITY. A POLICE OFFICER OR FIREFIGHTER SHALL BE ELIGIBLE  FOR
    9  AN  AWARD UNDER THIS SECTION PROVIDED THAT: (I) SUCH PERSON RESIDES IN A
   10  CITY WITH A POPULATION  BETWEEN  TWO  HUNDRED  FIFTY  THOUSAND  AND  ONE
   11  MILLION  WHICH HAS ENACTED A LOCAL LAW PROVIDING FOR SUCH POLICE OFFICER
   12  AND FIREFIGHTER LOAN FORGIVENESS PROGRAM, (II) SUCH  POLICE  OFFICER  OR
   13  FIREFIGHTER IS EMPLOYED IN SUCH CITY AS A POLICE OFFICER OR FIREFIGHTER,
   14  AND  (III)  SUCH  POLICE  OFFICER  OR  FIREFIGHTER INCURRED STUDENT LOAN
   15  EXPENSE WHILE ATTENDING BUFFALO STATE COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OF BUFFALO  OR
   16  ERIE COMMUNITY COLLEGE.
   17    3. DURATION. EACH AWARD SHALL ENTITLE THE RECIPIENT TO AN ANNUAL AWARD
   18  AND  A RECIPIENT SHALL BE ELIGIBLE FOR NO MORE THAN A TOTAL OF TWO THOU-
   19  SAND DOLLARS A YEAR FOR A MAXIMUM OF SIX YEARS.
   20    4. CALCULATION OF AWARD AMOUNTS. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE
   21  FOR CALCULATING THE DOLLAR AMOUNT OF EACH AWARD THAT ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES
   22  MAY RECEIVE FROM THIS PROGRAM.
   23    5. STUDENT LOAN EXPENSE. STUDENT LOAN EXPENSE SHALL MEAN  THE  CUMULA-
   24  TIVE  TOTAL  OF THE ANNUAL STUDENT LOANS COVERING THE COST OF ATTENDANCE
   25  AT BUFFALO STATE  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  OF  BUFFALO  OR  ERIE  COMMUNITY

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04714-01-1

       A. 2173                             2

    1  COLLEGE  WHICH ARE OUTSTANDING WHEN APPLICATION FOR SUCH PROGRAM IS MADE
    2  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION SIX OF THIS SECTION. INTEREST  PAID  OR  DUE  ON
    3  SUCH STUDENT LOANS THAT AN APPLICANT HAS TAKEN OUT FOR USE IN PAYING FOR
    4  SUCH EDUCATION SHALL BE CONSIDERED ELIGIBLE FOR REIMBURSEMENT UNDER THIS
    5  PROGRAM.
    6    6. APPLICATION AND SELECTION. APPLICATION SHALL BE MADE TO THE COMMIS-
    7  SIONER IN A MANNER PRESCRIBED BY THE COMMISSIONER.
    8    7. AWARD DISBURSEMENT. ANNUAL AWARD DISBURSEMENTS SHALL BE THE RESPON-
    9  SIBILITY  OF  THE  COMMISSIONER. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL FORWARD APPROVED
   10  APPLICATIONS TO THE PRESIDENT NO LATER THAN NINETY DAYS AFTER RECEIPT OF
   11  SUCH APPLICATIONS. WITHIN FORTY-FIVE DAYS, THE  PRESIDENT  SHALL  VERIFY
   12  THE APPROVED APPLICANTS' ELIGIBILITY AND TOTAL STUDENT LOAN EXPENSE.
   13    8.  NOTIFICATION.  THE  PRESIDENT SHALL NOTIFY THE COMMISSIONER OF THE
   14  AWARD ENTITLEMENT FOR EACH APPROVED APPLICANT PURSUANT TO THE  VERIFICA-
   15  TION PERFORMED IN SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF THIS SECTION.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
